meta.description: Require template literals instead of string concatenation

content.introduction:
Require template literals instead of string concatenation
üîßFixableSome problems reported by this rule are automatically fixable by the--fixcommand lineoption‚ùÑÔ∏èFrozenThis rule is currentlyfrozenand is not accepting feature requests.
Table of ContentsRule DetailsExamplesWhen Not To Use ItRelated RulesVersionResources
In ES2015 (ES6), we can use template literals instead of string concatenation.
conststr="Hello, "+name+"!";1Copy code to clipboard
conststr=`Hello,${name}!`;1Copy code to clipboard
